ch.supertomcat.bh.queue

Class DownloadQueueManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.supertomcat.bh.queue.DownloadQueueManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICalculateRateTimer, ISettingsListener

    public class DownloadQueueManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISettingsListener, ICalculateRateTimer
    This class manages the download-slots. It contains also the counters and restrictions for domains. So this class allows a Pic to download or let them wait until a slot is free.
    See Also:
    Restriction

      • manageDLSlots

        public void manageDLSlots()
        This method allows a Pic to start the download It checks the restrictions an counters and all needed things. This method is fired always when a download slot was give back to the queue and when a download slot is requested and the queue was empty before.

      • addDLSlotListener

        public void addDLSlotListener(IDownloadListener l)
        Requests a download slot
        Parameters:
        l - Listener

      • removeDLSlotListener

        public void removeDLSlotListener(IDownloadListener l)
        Gives the download-slot back to the queue This method must be used if the Pic has not the status Pic.WAITING. This method fires queueChanged on all listeners
        Parameters:
        l - Listener

      • removeDLSlotListenerStopping

        public void removeDLSlotListenerStopping(IDownloadListener l)
        Gives the download-slot back to the queue This method is only for a Pic with the status of Pic.WAITING. Because there is no download slot for a waiting pic, so the things done in removeDLSlotListener-Method are not needed in this case.
        Parameters:
        l - Listener

      • isDLSlotListenerRegistered

        public boolean isDLSlotListenerRegistered(IDownloadListener l)
        Returns if the listener is already registered
        Parameters:
        l - Listener
        Returns:
        True if the listener is already registered

        Returns if downloads are running or not
        Returns:

        Returns:
        Downloaded bytes

      • increaseSessionDownloadedFiles

        public void increaseSessionDownloadedFiles()
        Increases the downloaded files since application started by 1 This method will fire the sessionDownloadedFilesChanged-Method on all listeners.

      • increaseSessionDownloadedBytes

        public void increaseSessionDownloadedBytes(long downloadedBytes)
        Increases the downloaded bytes since application started by downloadedBytes So QueueData will take the actual value and add downloadedBytes. This method will fire the sessionDownloadedBytesChanged-Method on all listeners.
        Parameters:
        downloadedBytes - Downloaded bytes

      • addRestriction

        public void addRestriction(Restriction restriction)
        Adds a restriction If there is already a restriction for a domain the restriction is not added. But the value of maximum simultanious downloads from the restriction to add is taken and set to the existing restriction. So this method can be used to update a restriction
        Parameters:
        restriction - Restriction

      • removeRestriction

        public void removeRestriction(Restriction restriction)
        Removes a restriction
        Parameters:
        restriction - Restriction
